title: Oil major BP raises dividend as second-quarter profit beats expectations
content: British oil giant BP on Tuesday reported stronger-than-expected net profit for the second quarter following a warning over lower refining margins.
summary: British oil giant BP on Tuesday reported stronger-than-expected net profit for the second quarter following a warning over lower refining margins.

title: Dubai set to welcome even more millionaires as wealthy individuals abandon the UK
content: "Push factors include the prospect of higher taxes under a new Labour government," one investor told CNBC.
summary: "Push factors include the prospect of higher taxes under a new Labour government," one investor told CNBC.

title: Apple says its AI models were trained on Google's custom chips
content: Apple is using chips designed by Google in building its advanced AI models, according to a paper published on Monday.
summary: Apple is using chips designed by Google in building its advanced AI models, according to a paper published on Monday.

title: Where are China's ultra-rich parking their wealth amid a slowing economy?
content: The Chinese ultra-rich population is expected to swell to 144,897 by 2028 from 98,551 in 2023, where are they parking their wealth?
summary: The Chinese ultra-rich population is expected to swell to 144,897 by 2028 from 98,551 in 2023, where are they parking their wealth?

title: Japan's central bank starts its monetary policy meeting today. Here's what's in focus
content: Traders will be on the lookout for moves in two areas, namely, the bank's benchmark interest rates and its bond buying programme
summary: Traders will be on the lookout for moves in two areas, namely, the bank's benchmark interest rates and its bond buying programme

title: Disney's Marvel needed a direction. With a big box office and familiar faces, it may have one
content: "Deadpool & Wolverine" smashes box office records as Marvel Studios looks to right the ship after a series of theatrical missteps.
summary: "Deadpool & Wolverine" smashes box office records as Marvel Studios looks to right the ship after a series of theatrical missteps.

title: 'Sports tourism' is huge. But the Summer Olympics caused travel to Paris to plummet
content: It's a common misconception that host cities see an explosion of travelers around the Olympic Games, says OAG's Chief Analyst John Grant.
summary: It's a common misconception that host cities see an explosion of travelers around the Olympic Games, says OAG's Chief Analyst John Grant.

title: Self-driving tech company WeRide accelerates global expansion as transportation industry adopts AI
content: WeRide said it is the only company which has driverless permits from the U.S., China, UAE and Singapore, and plans to enter more markets.
summary: WeRide said it is the only company which has driverless permits from the U.S., China, UAE and Singapore, and plans to enter more markets.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Asian shares slide, U.S. stocks flat ahead of Big Tech earnings; McDonald's earnings miss
content: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite inched higher on Monday ahead of a busy week for Big Tech earnings.

title: Tencent Cloud downplays AI hype when it comes to making games
content: Use of ChatGPT-like generative AI in gaming is still in an exploratory phase, said Liang Chen, general manager of Tencent Cloud's internet industry department.
summary: Use of ChatGPT-like generative AI in gaming is still in an exploratory phase, said Liang Chen, general manager of Tencent Cloud's internet industry department.

title: Temu and Shein's soaring popularity has Wall Street eyeing China's influence on tech earnings

title: Asia-Pacific markets slide as the Bank of Japan begins its two-day policy meeting
content: Economists expect the BOJ to raise rates to 0.1%, up from its current range of 0% to 0.1%, according to a Reuters poll.
summary: Economists expect the BOJ to raise rates to 0.1%, up from its current range of 0% to 0.1%, according to a Reuters poll.

title: Trump wavers on Harris debate, says he could 'make a case' for skipping
content: Former President Donald Trump said that while he "probably" will debate Vice President Kamala Harris, he "could also make a case" for refusing to do so.
summary: Former President Donald Trump said that while he "probably" will debate Vice President Kamala Harris, he "could also make a case" for refusing to do so.

title: Harris VP short list stacked with contenders who can raise big money
content: Vice President Kamala Harris will have to find a way to keep raising a ton of money in order to contend with former President Donald Trump.

title: How the EV boom led Chinese companies to take over Indonesia’s nickel industry
content: Indonesia leads global nickel production for EV batteries with Chinese investment post-export ban, impacting prices and sustainability concerns.

title: McDonald's executives admit diners think prices are too high, say they're working to create value
content: McDonald's executives acknowledged that the company's prices have been high and they are taking a "forensic approach" to evaluating offerings.
summary: McDonald's executives acknowledged that the company's prices have been high and they are taking a "forensic approach" to evaluating offerings.

title: Apple will reportedly release artificial intelligence features in October, weeks after iOS 18 update
content: The company split the Apple Intelligence features from the initial iOS 18 launch due to concerns over their stability, a Bloomberg report said.

title: New Vanguard CEO says improving customer experience is a 'very high' priority and AI could help

title: Heineken shares fall 10% after first-half profit miss
content: Operting profit showed organic growth of 12.5%, below a company-compiled consensus forecast of 13.2%.

title: Ford, GM, Stellantis face a daunting second half of 2024
content: The U.S. market – a profit engine for most automakers – is normalizing after years of record high prices, low vehicle inventories and resilient demand.

title: AT&T, other phone companies sued over stolen nude images could face liability after court ruling
content: Companies like AT&T and T-Mobile have skirted liability when workers allegedly stole nude images from customer phones, but that may change after a court ruling.

title: Swiss pharma giant Roche to accelerate Wegovy rival drugs after positive trial data
